titlestmt.titleproper: Allen Collection of Frank O'Hara Letters
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Lytle Shaw.

address.addressline1: Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Betsy Pittman in May 2006.

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.repository: Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Center.
did.unittitle: Allen Collection of Frank O'Hara Letters.
did.abstract: Typewritten transcriptions by Donald Allen of Frank O'Hara letters. Allen collected and transcribed the letters while preparing and editing The Collected Poems of Frank O'Hara.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Typewritten transcriptions by Donald Allen of Frank O'Hara letters. Allen collected and transcribed the letters while preparing and editing The Collected Poems of Frank O'Hara.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Archives & Special Collections has a substantial collection of materials pertaining to [children's literature and associated artwork, nursing education and leadership, literature, various aspects of Connecticut history, Connecticut labor, Connecticut nursing education, New England railroad, Connecticut business records, Connecticut politics, the University, its history, administration, faculty, staff and students, etc.]. For detailed information on these collections please contact the curator or ask at the reference desk.

controlaccess.head: Index Terms
controlaccess.p: This record series is indexed under the following controlled access subject terms.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: There are no access restrictions on this collection.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish from these Papers must be obtained in writing from both the University of Connecticut Libraries and the owner(s) of the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: >[Item description, #:#], Allen Collection of Frank O'Hara Letters. Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Libraries.
